article.headline: Pepperdine 78, Colorado State 63
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. (AP) -- Glen McGowan scored a season-high 31 points and had a career-high 22 rebounds to lead Pepperdine to a 78-63 win over Colorado State on Monday night. McGowan, a senior who needed three points to reach 1,000 for his career, was nine of 19 from the floor and 10 of 18 from the free-throw line. Ten of his rebounds came on the offense end. Alex Acker had 18 points and five assists for Pepperdine, while Yakhouba Diawara added 12 points. Jon Rakiecki led Colorado State (8-5) with 18 points. Colorado State twice whittled down what was mostly a double-digit deficit to seven in the last 3 minutes. But after making just 17 of its first 30 free-throw attempts, the Waves (10-5) sealed the game by making 11 of 13 in the final 2 minutes. Three Colorado State players fouled out, including Matt Nelson, the Rams' standout center who came in having made 79.6 percent of his shots over his last four games. He scored 10 points before fouling out with 3:06 left. Center Stuart Creason and guard Andrew Patterson also fouled out.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
